thread.title: South Korea’s Former President Is Jailed for 24 Years

author: Eun-Young Jeong
title: South Korea’s Former President Is Jailed for 24 Years
text:
SEOUL—A court sentenced former South Korean President Park Geun-hye to 24 years in prison for her involvement in a corruption scandal that led to her ouster from office and ensnared some of the country’s top officials and business leaders.

The ruling on Friday, which included a fine of about $16.8 million, fell short of the 30-year prison term and $110 million fine prosecutors had sought. Still, the sentence handed to Ms. Park, the 66-year-old daughter of South Korea’s longest-serving president, was the heaviest the courts... RELATED VIDEO South Korea's Ex-President Park Guen-hye Jailed After Court Verdict A South Korean court on Friday granted an arrest warrant against ex-president Park Geun-hye, ordering her to a jail cell while prosecutors seek an indictment against the former leader, who was impeached three weeks ago. Photo: AP (Originally published March 30, 2017)
